vulnerability_findings.name: inefficient-state-variable-increment
vulnerability_findings.message: <x> += <y> costs more gas than <x> = <x> + <y> for state variables.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(initialExchangeRateMantissa > 0, "Initial exchange rate must be greater than zero.");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: compound-borrowfresh-reentrancy
vulnerability_findings.message: Function borrowFresh() in Compound performs state update after doTransferOut()

vulnerability_findings.name: controlled-delegatecall
vulnerability_findings.message:
Unitroller.fallback (Unitroller.sol#2636-2650) uses delegatecall to a input-controlled function id
	(success) = comptrollerImplementation.delegatecall(msg.data) (Unitroller.sol#2638-2640)

vulnerability_findings.name: erc20-interface
vulnerability_findings.message:
EIP20NonStandardInterface (Unitroller.sol#719-781) has incorrect ERC20 function interface(s):
	-transfer (Unitroller.sol#745)
	-transferFrom (Unitroller.sol#759)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CToken._reduceReserves (Unitroller.sol#2276-2286):
	External calls:
	- error = accrueInterest() (Unitroller.sol#2277-2278)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- totalReserves (Unitroller.sol#2283-2286)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CToken._setComptroller (Unitroller.sol#2207-2226):
	External calls:
	- require(bool,string)(newComptroller.isComptroller(),marker method returned false) (Unitroller.sol#2215-2217)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- comptroller (Unitroller.sol#2218-2220)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CToken._setInterestRateModel (Unitroller.sol#2346-2357):
	External calls:
	- error = accrueInterest() (Unitroller.sol#2347-2348)
	- _setInterestRateModelFresh(newInterestRateModel) (Unitroller.sol#2353-2356)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- interestRateModel (Unitroller.sol#2353-2356)

Reentrancy in CToken._setInterestRateModelFresh (Unitroller.sol#2362-2393):

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CToken.accrueInterest (Unitroller.sol#1446-1512):
	External calls:
	- (vars.opaqueErr,vars.borrowRateMantissa) = interestRateModel.getBorrowRate(getCashPrior(),totalBorrows,totalReserves) (Unitroller.sol#1450-1451)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- totalBorrows (Unitroller.sol#1503-1504)
	- totalReserves (Unitroller.sol#1504-1506)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CToken.borrowInternal (Unitroller.sol#1776-1786):

	- error = accrueInterest() (Unitroller.sol#1777-1778)
	- borrowFresh(msg.sender,borrowAmount) (Unitroller.sol#1783-1784)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- totalBorrows (Unitroller.sol#1783-1784)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CToken.liquidateBorrowInternal (Unitroller.sol#2001-2018):

	- totalBorrows (Unitroller.sol#2015-2016)

vulnerability_findings.name: Exception State (SWC 110)
vulnerability_findings.message:
An assertion violation was triggered.
It is possible to trigger an assertion violation. Note that Solidity assert() statements should only be used to check invariants. Review the transaction trace generated for this issue and either make sure your program logic is correct, or use require() instead of assert() if your goal is to constrain user inputs or enforce preconditions. Remember to validate inputs from both callers (for instance, via passed arguments) and callees (for instance, via return values).
Classification: SWC-110
